{"step_by_step_thinking": "Granulation tissue is formed during the proliferative phase of wound healing. According to the documents, the molecular organization of collagen in granulation tissue is different from normal skin, with an increased amount of type III collagen resembling embryonic tissue. Type V collagen is also present in granulation tissue. Type I collagen is stronger and replaces type III collagen during the maturation phase of wound healing. Therefore, the correct answer is C. Type III.", "answer_choice": "C"}
